name: mysti
description: Multi-agent AI coding assistant. Claude Code, Codex, Gemini, and GitHub Copilot brainstorm together, debate approaches, and deliver superior solutions. Like Cursor & Copilot, but with collaborative AI agents.

enumDescriptions: Claude Code CLI (Anthropic) - Deep reasoning, complex refactoring, thorough analysis
OpenAI Codex CLI - Quick iterations, familiar GPT style, rapid prototyping
Google Gemini CLI - Fast responses, Google ecosystem integration
Cline - Autonomous coding agent with browser use, file editing, and command execution
GitHub Copilot CLI - GitHub-native AI assistant with seamless GitHub integration
Cursor - AI-powered coding with fast editing and multi-file changes
OpenClaw - Open-source personal AI assistant with multi-model support and Gateway streaming
mysti.defaultProvider.description: Primary AI provider for coding assistance. Switch providers anytime without losing context.

mysti.claudeCodePath.description: Path to Claude Code CLI executable

mysti.codexPath.description: Path to OpenAI Codex CLI executable

mysti.geminiPath.description: Path to Google Gemini CLI executable

mysti.copilotPath.description: Path to GitHub Copilot CLI executable

mysti.cursorApiKey.description: Cursor API key. Set this instead of the CURSOR_API_KEY environment variable. Get your key from Cursor settings.

mysti.openclawGatewayUrl.description: URL of the OpenClaw Gateway WebSocket server

mysti.openclawUseGateway.description: Use OpenClaw Gateway WebSocket for streaming (falls back to CLI if unavailable)

mysti.defaultThinkingLevel.description: Default thinking level for AI responses

mysti.claudeCodeModel.description: Custom model for Claude Code. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929

mysti.codexModel.description: Custom model for OpenAI Codex. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: gpt-5.3-codex

mysti.codexProfile.description: Codex profile from ~/.codex/config.toml. Leave empty to use default profile.

mysti.geminiModel.description: Custom model for Google Gemini. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: gemini-3-pro-preview

mysti.clineModel.description: Custom model for Cline. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929

mysti.copilotModel.description: Custom model for GitHub Copilot. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: claude-opus-4.6

mysti.cursorModel.description: Custom model for Cursor. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the default model. Example: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929

mysti.openclawModel.description: Custom model for OpenClaw. Overrides the dropdown selection. Leave empty to use the selected model. Example: claude-opus-4-6

enumDescriptions: AI can only read files, never modify - safest option for exploring codebases
AI asks before each file change - balanced control and productivity
AI can edit files autonomously - maximum speed for trusted tasks
mysti.accessLevel.description: Control what the AI can do with your files. Choose based on your trust level and task requirements.

mysti.autoContext.description: Automatically include open files and selections as context for better AI responses

mysti.compaction.enabled.description: Enable automatic context compaction when token usage exceeds the threshold

mysti.compaction.threshold.description: Context usage percentage at which automatic compaction triggers (50-95%)

mysti.activeMode.enabled.description: Show Active Mode panel and connect to OpenClaw daemon automatically (provider-independent)

mysti.activeMode.showActivityFeed.description: Show cross-channel activity feed in Active Mode panel

mysti.activeMode.activityLimit.description: Maximum number of activity entries to display

mysti.activeMode.autoStartDaemon.description: Automatically start OpenClaw daemon if not running on extension activation

mysti.lifecycle.enabled.description: Enable agent lifecycle management with idle timeout and process tree protection

mysti.lifecycle.idleTimeoutMinutes.description: Minutes of inactivity before an agent session is automatically cleared (1-1440)

mysti.lifecycle.processTreeTracking.description: Track child processes spawned by CLI agents to prevent premature shutdown

mysti.lifecycle.protectActiveChildren.description: Block automatic shutdown when the agent has active child processes (requires explicit user action)

mysti.lifecycle.checkIntervalSeconds.description: Seconds between process tree scans for idle sessions (10-300)

mysti.showSuggestions.description: Show quick action suggestions after AI responses

mysti.brainstorm.enabled.description: Enable multi-agent brainstorm mode where two AI providers collaborate, debate, and synthesize solutions

enumDescriptions: Quick - Direct synthesis without discussion (fastest)
Structured Debate - Agents critique each other's reasoning with rebuttals
Red Team - One agent proposes, the other challenges, then defense
Perspective Lenses - Risk analysis vs. opportunity analysis
Delphi Convergence - Facilitator-mediated iterative refinement
mysti.brainstorm.strategy.description: Collaboration strategy for brainstorm mode. Determines how agents interact as a team.

enumDescriptions: Direct synthesis - faster, agents don't explicitly discuss
Full discussion - agents review and comment on each other's responses (maps to 'debate' strategy)
mysti.brainstorm.discussionMode.description: Deprecated: Use mysti.brainstorm.strategy instead. Kept for backward compatibility.

mysti.brainstorm.maxDiscussionRounds.description: Maximum discussion rounds for debate and delphi strategies (may stop early with auto-converge)

mysti.brainstorm.autoConverge.description: Automatically stop discussion when agents reach consensus (reduces unnecessary rounds)

mysti.brainstorm.synthesisAgent.description: Agent to use for synthesis in brainstorm mode

mysti.brainstorm.agents.description: Select any 2 of 7 AI providers to collaborate in brainstorm mode. Different combinations offer unique strengths.

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.claudePersona.description: Persona for Claude agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.claudeCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Claude (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt

mysti.agents.codexCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Codex (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.geminiPersona.description: Persona for Gemini agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.geminiCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Gemini (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.clinePersona.description: Persona for Cline agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.clineCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Cline (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.copilotPersona.description: Persona for Copilot agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.copilotCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Copilot (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.cursorPersona.description: Persona for Cursor agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.cursorCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for Cursor (when persona is 'custom')

enumDescriptions: No additional framing
Focus on system design and patterns
Focus on practical implementation
Focus on technical correctness and performance
Focus on code quality and issues
Focus on API design and UX
Use custom prompt
mysti.agents.openclawPersona.description: Persona for OpenClaw agent in brainstorm mode

mysti.agents.openclawCustomPrompt.description: Custom persona prompt for OpenClaw (when persona is 'custom')

mysti.agents.autoSuggest.description: Smart persona suggestions: Mysti analyzes your message and recommends the best persona (Architect, Debugger, etc.) for your task

mysti.agents.maxTokenBudget.description: Limit tokens used for agent context. Set to 0 for unlimited (default). Use lower values to reduce API costs.

mysti.permission.timeout.description: Seconds to wait for permission approval (0 = no timeout, requires explicit action)

enumDescriptions: Automatically approve the action when timeout expires
Automatically deny the action when timeout expires
No timeout - require explicit user action
AI makes an intelligent decision using safety classification and learned preferences when timeout expires
mysti.permission.timeoutBehavior.description: Behavior when permission request times out

mysti.semiAutonomous.timeout.description: Seconds before AI takes over in semi-autonomous mode. Applies to both permission requests and questions.

mysti.useShellForCli.description: Run AI provider CLIs using a shell (sets shell=true when spawning processes). Enable this on Windows if you see "spawn EINVAL" errors with CLI .cmd wrappers.

mysti.debugVerbose.description: Pass --verbose flag to CLI providers (Claude Code, Cline). Adds extra diagnostic output but may slow responses. Only enable for debugging.

enumDescriptions: Only auto-approve read and create operations
Auto-approve edits to existing files within workspace
Auto-approve most operations (destructive actions always blocked)
mysti.autonomous.safetyMode.description: Safety level for autonomous mode decisions

mysti.autonomous.maxSessionDuration.description: Maximum hours for an autonomous session (0 = unlimited)

mysti.autonomous.maxMemoryEntries.description: Maximum number of memory entries to store

mysti.autonomous.blockPatterns.description: Additional regex patterns to block in autonomous mode (e.g. dangerous commands)

mysti.autonomous.allowFileCreation.description: Allow autonomous mode to create new files

mysti.autonomous.allowFileEdit.description: Allow autonomous mode to edit existing files

mysti.autonomous.allowBashCommands.description: Allow autonomous mode to run bash commands (destructive commands always blocked)

enumDescriptions: Provide a high-level goal and the agent continues until it's met
Provide a list of tasks and the agent works through them sequentially
mysti.autonomous.continuationMode.description: How autonomous mode handles task continuation
